definition: to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax

sentences.english: Thus, the actual residence and the property was formed between a so-called lease.
sentences.chinese: 因此，实际居住和财产之间形成一个所谓的租赁。

sentences.english: The treatise discusses the nature of leasehold.
sentences.chinese: 本文讨论的是租赁权的性质问题。

sentences.english: " he then rented it out and moved to Cape Town.
sentences.chinese: ，他将这栋别墅租赁出去后搬到了开普敦。

sentences.english: Sam says, "The landlord pays for the gas, but the tenant pays for all other utilities."
sentences.chinese: 山姆说，“房主付气费，租赁者付其他所有费用。”

sentences.english: Controvercies abound in the finance literature concerning leasing.
sentences.chinese: 和租赁有关的金融文献中充满了争议。

sentences.english: The house in the Rue Plumet being held on a lease, still belonged to Cosette.
sentences.chinese: 卜吕梅街的房子原有租赁契约，现在还属于珂赛特。

sentences.english: Please send me your catalogue and terms and conditions for leasing.
sentences.chinese: 请寄来贵公司的商品目录并将租赁条件函告。

sentences.english: That " day hires room " how to be rented, can be you put in a few hidden trouble?
sentences.chinese: 那“日租房”如何租赁，会不会存在一些隐患呢？

sentences.english: For proponents of the anti-stuff movement, renting is in.
sentences.chinese: 对反物质运动的支持者来说，租赁现正流行。

sentences.english: A landlord and a new tenant are talking about rules of the building.
sentences.chinese: 一个房东和一个新房客正在讨论租赁房屋的条例。

sentences.english: These Procedures are applicable to the lease of state-owned land within the administrative areas of this Municipality.
sentences.chinese: 本办法适用于本市行政区域内的国有土地租赁活动。

sentences.english: Many times a substantial portion of your leasing costs can be written off.
sentences.chinese: 很多次，相当一部分您的租赁费，可以注销。

sentences.english: Stay in 2-room rental flat, or smaller.
sentences.chinese: 住租赁组屋2房式或更小。

sentences.english: The rent is payable monthly in one lump sum, before the tenth day of each month.
sentences.chinese: 每月租金一次支付，必须于租赁期每月前十天付清。

definition: to lease/to hire/to rent (sth from sb)
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
borrower/leaser/the hiring side of a contract
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to rent/to charter/to rent land or a house for subletting/fixed rent for farmland
